panels.description: The time needed for the importer to read documents from the zeebe records index for a single import batch.
panels.title: Import latencies, 10 min average, sec

panels.description: Throughput of documents processed and imported.
panels.title: Throughput Exported and Imported records (avg)

panels.description: Shows the time (latency) between writing the command to the dispatcher, processing, exporting, and then importing the record.
panels.title: Latency (avg)

panels.description: The time it takes for the importer to read an record on average from ES
panels.title: Importing: read duration

panels.description: Time the import writer thread needs on average to process an ImportBatch (containing several Zeebe records).
panels.title: Import processing duration (AVG)

panels.description: The time it takes to write the bulk requests (during importing) to ES on average.
panels.title: Importing: write duration (avg)

panels.description: There is a queue of import jobs where each job has to import a batch of records. This details how many such jobs are currently in the queue.
panels.title: Import queue size

panels.description: Each time a non empty bulk request if flushed, this is how long the flush takes.
panels.title: Camunda Exporter (Flush Duration)

panels.description: The rate of failure of flush operations, averaged over 15s intervals
panels.title: Camunda Exporter (Flush Failure Rate)

panels.description: When bulk request flushes fail, the type of error returned is counted.
panels.title: Camunda Exporter (Flush Failure Type)

panels.description: The time in seconds since the last flush.
panels.title: Camunda Exporter (Time since last flush)

panels.description: For each exporter how far behind is it from exporting the records which have been committed.

targets.expr: max (zeebe_log_appender_last_committed_position{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", partition=~"$partition"}) by (partition) - max (zeebe_exporter_last_exported_position{cluster=~"$cluster", namespace=~"$namespace", partition=~"$partition", exporter="camundaexporter"}) by (partition)

panels.title: Camunda Exporter (Records to export backlog)

panels.description: For every non empty flush of a bulk request, this is the number of entities flushed.
panels.title: Camunda Exporter (Bulk Size)

panels.description: How long an export request is open and collecting new records before flushing.
panels.title: Camunda Exporter (Flush Latency)

panels.description: Shows the rate of evictions of the process cache
panels.title: Process cache eviction

panels.description: Shows the rate of access to the process cache per partition
panels.title: Process cache access

panels.description: The time the cache spent computing or retrieving the new value
panels.title: Cache load duration

panels.description: Historgram, to show the distribution of the duration of search requests to find completed entities, which should be archived.
panels.title: Archiving - Search request duration

panels.description: Historgram, to show the distribution of durations reindex requests take, to copy data from runtime to dated indices.
panels.title: Archiving - Reindex request duration

panels.description: Historgram, to show the distribution of durations delete requests take, to delete data from runtime indices.
panels.title: Archiving - Delete request duration

panels.description: The rate of the loading data into the cache
panels.title: Cache load rate

panels.description: Shows the rate of archiving (in-progress) and archived process instance and batch operations. Batch operations or process instances need to be completed before being able to be archived. The rate is aggregated by partition.
panels.title: Archiving

panels.description: Histogram to show the distribution of the overall archiving duration, which includes searching, reindexing, and deletion.
panels.title: Archiving duration

panels.description: Each time a non empty bulk request if flushed, this is how long the flush takes.
panels.title: Elasticsearch Exporter (Flush Duration)

panels.description: The rate of failure of flush operations, averaged over 15s intervals
panels.title: Elasticsearch Exporter (Flush Failure Rate)

panels.description: For every non empty flush of a bulk request, this is the number of entities flushed.
panels.title: Elasticsearch Exporter (Bulk Size)

panels.description: Each bulk request has a number of records, the memory usage to flush this bulk request is crudely measured through content length and tracked here.
panels.title: Elasticsearch Exporter (Bulk Memory Size)

panels.description: How long an export request is open and collecting new records before flushing.
panels.title: RDBMS Exporter (Flush Latency)

panels.description: The rate of failure of flush operations, averaged over 15s intervals
panels.title: RDBMS Exporter (Flush Failure Rate)
RDBMS Exporter JDBC Statements Batch factor
